Job Details

New ideas are all around us, but only a few will change the world. That’s our focus at JPL. We ask the biggest questions, then search the universe for answers—literally. We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a campus-like environment situated on 177 acres in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

Responsibilities

The Office of Safety and Mission Success (OSMS) provides subject matter expertise, Technical Authority to assess risks and assure flight safety and mission success. We are seeking a Division Staff Assistant for the Mission Assurance Office. You will be a member of the Business Administration team for Division (51) and be responsible for providing support to the Division leadership team.

Responsibilities Include but are not limited to:

  • Manage calendars for the Division leadership team which entails proactively evaluating management commitments and coordinating the proper adjustments to help them meet those commitments
  • Provide leadership and mentoring to Section and Group Staff Assistants and ensure application of standard policies and procedures; coordinate learning opportunities
  • Foster a professional tone in the Division office, receiving and escorting visitors and guests as appropriate
  • Compose and edit a wide range of correspondence, presentation materials, proposals and reports, and serve as the Subject Matter Expert for electronic libraries, records and other web based communication/collaboration tools
  • Process travel authorizations and expense reports, and lead all aspects of Division office equipment and supplies, and maintain expenditures within an established budget
  • Maintain the Division organization chart, enter work authorizations (WAMs), and coordinate events/presentations

Qualifications:

Typically requires a High School diploma with a minimum of 10 years of related experience; Associates degree with a minimum of 6 years of related experience; or Bachelor’s degree with a minimum of 3 years of related experience; related required training

  • Extensive expertise in the secretarial profession with strong organizational, interpersonal and digital literacy
  • Experience as a staff assistant in a section office or equivalent environment
  • Ability to get along with all levels of personnel and provide excellent customer service
  • Understanding of general, detailed, and specialized job aspects and work techniques related to office operations
  • Advanced understanding of computer-based office applications and tools (e.g. MS Office Suite of Applications, Adobe Acrobat, JPL Wiki, SharePoint) and web navigation
  • Proven track record of evaluating situations and applying good judgment in resolving unique problems
  • Ability to identify and implement process improvements that increase the efficiency of the office
  • Significant experience maintaining multiple, dynamic calendars and scheduling meetings for high-level management staff and public conference rooms
  • Reliable, organized and detail oriented, with the ability to adapt as work requirements and priorities change
  • Demonstrated ability to work successfully under pressure on multiple tasks, meet time commitments and deliver high-quality work products
  • Exercise discretion when handling assignments of a discreet nature
  • Motivated self-starter who takes initiative to perform activities under minimal direction and deliver timely results
  • Excellent typing, spelling, grammar, written and verbal communication skills

Preferred Skills:

  • Extensive understanding of JPL policies, procedures and practices
  • Understanding of the JPL matrix organizational structure, the various line organization and program/project offices
  • Subject matter authority in M365, Timekeeping, Travel, Calendaring, SharePoint
  • Sophisticated use of the following JPL systems: P-Card, iProcurement, Unified Charging System (UCS), JPLID (On/Off boarding), Communications Service Requests (CSR) & JPLIT
  • Experience with the following processes/business systems: Property Manager Gateway, Data Extractor/JPL Business Reporting, JPL Assets Database, personnel moves, minor facilities/office amenities requests, and office ergonomics and general safety, website development and/or maintenance; experience with MS SharePoint and JPL Wiki, and COVID-19 task restart processes and travel procedures
